text: A careful microbiological and remaining virological workup is necessary to define by exclusion isolated HSV-1 pneumonitis. Unfortunately, results of bacterial sampling are often falsely negative, be it due to inadequately low amounts material, assay insensitivity or prior antibiotic use, to name just a few. This is also illustrated by the 60% of cases of pneumonia in our study in which no offending agent was detected despite clinical evidence of infection.
